alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Macon; Schley; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Macon, west central Dooly, southeastern Schley and northeastern Sumter Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Clearview, or near Oglethorpe, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Oglethorpe, Montezuma, Andersonville, Andersonville National Historic, Clearview, Bumphead and Pennington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
